fields.headline: Watchdog to delay decision
fields.bodyText: The Competition Commission is expected to announce, possibly as soon as today, that it will take an extra eight weeks to consider the competition implications of a takeover of the London Stock Exchange. The competition watchdog had intended to finish its analysis of the possible bids by the German exchange Deutsche Börse and Euronext, the Dutch-French combine, by September 12. However, it is now understood that a final ruling will not be made until early November. Deutsche Börse first revealed its interest in December last year. However, it is now thought unlikely to bid because of opposition to the deal from its shareholders, while the Australian bank Macquarie said on Monday that it was considering a bid for the LSE.
